action.action-desc: Ms. Malliotakis (for herself and Mrs. Steel) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to rename the standard deduction the guaranteed deduction, and to add a bonus amount to the guaranteed deduction for taxable years 2024 and 2025.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Working Families Tax Cut Act.

subsection.text: Section 63 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking standard deduction each place it appears and inserting guaranteed deduction, and

subparagraph.text: in the heading, by striking Standard deduction and inserting Guaranteed deduction,
in the heading of paragraph (2), by striking standard deduction and inserting guaranteed deduction,
in the heading of paragraph (3), by striking standard deduction and inserting guaranteed deduction,
in the heading of paragraph (5), by striking standard deduction and inserting guaranteed deduction,
in the heading of paragraph (6), by striking standard deduction and inserting guaranteed deduction, and
in the heading of paragraph (7)(A), by striking standard deduction and inserting guaranteed deduction.

subparagraph.text: in the heading, by striking Standard deduction and inserting Guaranteed deduction, and

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2023.
Section 63(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (as amended by section 2) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Bonus guaranteed deduction for taxable years 2024 and 2025

subparagraph.text: In the case of a taxable year beginning after December 31, 2023, and before January 1, 2026, the guaranteed deduction shall be increased by the amount of the bonus guaranteed deduction.
For purposes of this paragraph, the bonus guaranteed deduction is—

clause.text: $4,000 in the case of a joint return or a surviving spouse (as defined in section 2(a)),
$3,000 in the case of a head of household, and

subparagraph.text: In the case of a taxable year beginning after 2024, each dollar amount in subparagraph (B) shall be increased by an amount equal to—

clause.text: the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting 2023 for 2016 in subparagraph (A)(ii) thereof.

subparagraph.continuation-text: If any increase under this subparagraph is not a multiple of $50, such increase shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $50.

subparagraph.header: Limitation on bonus guaranteed deduction based on modified adjusted gross income

clause.text: The bonus guaranteed deduction determined under subparagraph (B) shall be reduced (but not below zero) by 5 percent of so much of the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income as exceeds the threshold amount. For purposes of the preceding sentence, the term modified adjusted gross income means adjusted gross income increased by any amount excluded from gross income under section 911, 931, or 933.
For purposes of clause (i), the threshold amount is—

subclause.text: $400,000 in the case of a joint return or a surviving spouse (as defined in section 2(a)),
$300,000 in the case of a head of household, and

subsection.text: The amendments made by this subsection shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2023.
